alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 9:07PM PST until February 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO NOON PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations will be generally up to 6 inches below 6,000 feet. Areas above 6,000 feet will receive 6 to 10 inches with localized amounts over one foot. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains, including along Interstate 15 through the Cajon Pass. * WHEN...4 PM Tuesday to noon Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions, especially during the Tuesday evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Visibility greatly reduced in blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow on Tuesday night. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
